Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.manager

Web application management interface.

This package provides a web-based management interface for the servlet container, allowing administrators to deploy, undeploy, start, stop, and monitor web applications.

Key Components

  • ManagerServlet - The main management servlet handling admin requests
  • ManagerContextService - Interface for context management operations
  • ManagerContainerService - Interface for container management operations

Management Operations

  • list - List all deployed web applications
  • deploy - Deploy a new web application
  • undeploy - Remove a deployed application
  • start - Start a stopped application
  • stop - Stop a running application
  • reload - Reload an application (hot deployment)
  • sessions - View active session information

Deployment

The manager application is deployed as a standard WAR file within the container's context list: 


 <container id="mainContainer">
   <property name="contexts">
     <list>
       <context path="/manager" root="dist/manager.war"/>
     </list>
   </property>
 </container>

Security

The manager webapp is protected by standard servlet security constraints. Access requires authentication and membership in the manager role. The webapp's web.xml configures HTTP Basic authentication by default.

To grant access, configure a realm with users in the manager role and associate it with the container: 


 <realm id="mainRealm" class="org.bluezoo.gumdrop.BasicRealm">
   <property name="href">realm.xml</property>
 </realm>

 <container id="mainContainer">
   <property name="realms">
     <map>
       <entry key="Gumdrop Manager" ref="#mainRealm"/>
     </map>
   </property>
   ...
 </container>

The realm XML file defines groups (with id for linking and name for the role) and users (referencing groups by id via IDREFS): 


 <realm>
   <!-- id is for IDREFS linking, name is the role for authorization -->
   <group id="managerGroup" name="manager"/>
   
   <!-- users reference groups by id (space-separated for multiple) -->
   <user name="admin" password="secret" groups="managerGroup"/>
 </realm>

Important: In production, the manager should only be accessible over HTTPS to protect credentials in transit.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    FilterReg
    Extension to FilterRegistration.Dynamic to additionally provide Description interface.
    ManagerContainerService
    Remote interface to access a web application container and list its contexts.
    ManagerContextService
    Remote interface to manage a web application context.
    ServletReg
    Extension to ServlerRegistration.Dynamic to additionally provide Description interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    HitStatistics
    Hit statistics for a context.
    ManagerServlet
    Gumdrop servlet context manager servlet.
